p: The compound isobavachalcone has been isolated from plants of the Fabaceae and Moraceae families [ 88, 89]. Isobavachalcone shows a strong antioxidant activity in DPPH SC 50, FRAP, and ABTS SC 50 assays with values of 250.8 μM, 0.4 ± 0.05 mM equivalent to FeSO 4·7H 2O, and 510.1 mM, respectively. In addition, the compound has been reported to inhibit the NF- κB pathway in Sephadex-induced lung injury in rats [ 88, 90].
